editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: MARCO POLO, HETHOUM, PALLADIUS; S. XIV in., XII 4/4

physDesc.p: Two originally separate volumes, probably only brought together with the present binding.

supportDesc.extent:
135 leaves (ii + 133) 255 190
The edges retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: 1–412, 58, 6–912 / 10–118, 128(+ 1 before 1), a bifolium. The quires of part I have catchwords.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i-ii and 132–3 are paper binding leaves, the outermost from the same printed book as in MS 68. At the foot of f. 130 (but not f. 131) is the mark of the large iron chain-staple. This leaf was formerly a pastedown, so the bifolium fols. 130–1 is probably bound inside-out.

history.provenance: At the head of f. 1, cropped, ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxonia per dominum Ricardum Wykyng nuper uicarium ecclesie de Westwelle in Cancia iuxta Cantuariam (in a later hand qui fuit clericus M. Thome Bradwardyn Cantuariensis archiepiscopi)’. He also gave MS 244.
Both parts are in the 1556 List (UO65. 191, 205) and in James (nos 58, 198) as separate entities (‘58’ is at the head of f. 1).

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper, with ‘K. 4, 11’ (canc.) and a table of contents, s. xvii, and ‘Q. 3. 14. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘H. 3. 12 (CCCXII)’ in red. ‘14’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

msItem.author: MARCO POLO
msItem.title: Descriptio Orbis Terrarum
msItem.note: (in the Latin version of PIPINUS OP)
msItem.incipit: Librum prudentis honorabilis ac fidelissimi domini Marci Pauli de Venetiis de condicionibus orientalium regionum ...
(f. 2) Tempore quo Balduinius sceptra Constantinopol’ inperii gubernabat
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber domini Marci Pauli de Veneciis de condicionibus et consuetudinibus orientalium regionum.

msItem.author: HETHOUM
msItem.title: Flos Historiarum Terrae Orientalis
msItem.rubric: Iste liber intitulatur flos ystoriarum terre orientis quem compilauit frater Haytonus dominus Churchi consanguineus regis Armenie ex mandato summi pontificis sanctissimi domini nostri Clementis pape quinti anno incarnacionis dominice millesimo CCC. VII in ciuitate Pictauensis regis Francie R. Diuiditur autem liber iste in quattuor partes
msItem.incipit: Regnum Cathay est maius regum quod in orbe sit
msItem.explicit: illam repleat et conseruet qui potens est Deus in s. s. amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber ystoriarum partium orientis quem ego Nicholaus Falconi scripsi primo in Gallico ydiomate secundum quod uir religiosus frater Haytonus ordinis Premonstratensium dominus Churchi consanguineus domini regis Armenie ore suo absque nota siue aliquo exemplari de uerbo ad uerbum dictauit et de gallico transtuli in latinum anno Domini millesimo CCCC. VII. mense Augusti in ciuitate Pictauensis tempore sanctissimi patris domini Clementis pape Quinti.
msItem.note: Ed. C. Kohler et al., Receuil des historiens des croisades: Documents arméniens II (Paris, 1906), pp. 261–363; this copy mentioned p. cxv, but not collated.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 37 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single cursiva formata, French or Italian.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

origin.origPlace: script of French or Italian appearance.

msItem.author: PALLADIUS
msItem.title: De Agricultura
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. in March) possit cicius nasci
msItem.finalRubric: Palladii Rutili Emiliani uiri illustris opus agriculture explicit.

msItem.note: On f. 130 is a note, in a rough hand s. xii ex., on the succession of the English kings, William I to Henry II (‘qui leo iusticie ... apellatus est’) and his four sons. Fols. 130v-1v blank.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 40 long lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single English early gothic bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red or green initials, plain or flourished in the other colour.
